item.title: MLS - RFC 9420
item.description: ‚ú® We are thrilled to announce the release of the MLS specification as RFC 9420. item.title: HACL
item.description: HACL is a set of formally verified cryptographic libraries in C, JavaScript, OCaml, and Rust. The libraries are based on the HACL* research project, originally developed by Inria and Microsoft Research.

item.title: hacspec
item.description: hacspec is a language and framework for writing succinct, executable, formally verifiable specifications for cryptographic components. Syntactically, hacspec is a purely functional subset of Rust that aims to be readable by developers, cryptographers, and verification experts.

item.title: HPKE
item.description: HPKE is scheme provides a variant of public-key encryption of arbitrary-sized plaintexts for a recipient public key. It includes three authenticated variants, including one which authenticates possession of a pre-shared key, and two optional ones which authenticate possession of a KEM private key.

item.title: TL;DR - Hybrid Public Key Encryption
item.description: HPKE, defined in RFC 9180, is a CFRG standard that describes a scheme for hybrid public key encryption. It is co-authored by my Cryspen co-founder Karthikeyan Bhargavan and one of his PhD students Benjamin Lipp as part of his research at Inria.
